text: Stanley Hunter Ramsay (10 August 1904 – 19 July 1989) was a footballer and a member of the Norwich City Hall of Fame. Ryton-born Ramsay made 82 appearances for Norwich as a left-half and left-back between 1932 and 1934, scoring once Norwich Evening News accessed 2 November 2007 (see List of Norwich City F.C. club records). Before playing for Norwich, Ramsay appeared for Blackpool and Sunderland. He captained Norwich to the club's first-ever honour, the championship of Division Three (South) in 1934. After Ramsay left Norwich, he became player-manager of Shrewsbury Town. ==References== ;Specific ;General * Category:1904 births Category:1989 deaths Category:English footballers Category:Norwich City F.C. players Category:Blackpool F.C. players Category:Sunderland A.F.C. players Category:English football managers Category:Shrewsbury Town F.C. managers Category:People from Ryton, Tyne and Wear Category:Association football forwards Category:Association football midfielders
title: Stan Ramsay
